title: Want to see the inside of the Goodyear Blimp? Now you can even sleep in it
text:
CLOSE

Who's dreamed of seeing the inside of a Goodyear Blimp?

If the answer is you, then mark your calendars for Oct. 15. That's when you can jump on the chance to not just see the inside but book an overnight stay in the iconic airship.

Limited booking opportunities will roll out throughout the day on Airbnb.com/blimp for one-night stays inside the blimp in its hangar in Mogadore, Ohio, Oct. 22, 23 and 24.

The stay is hosted by Goodyear Chief Pilot Jerry Hissem and is $150 a night, plus taxes and fees.

“Just like any host, we will be opening up our home to give the guests the best experience," Hissem told USA TODAY. "They will have a tour of our facilities, highlighting our 100 year history and 60+ years of covering college football games. They will get to enjoy Wingfoot Lake and the complete tailgate experience. And, they will get to meet many of our crew and learn about the blimp.”

The Airbnb promotion marks the first time Goodyear Blimp fans will be allowed to sleep inside the gondola. (Photo: Airbnb)

Hissem said guests will not get to ride in the blimp, which is set to capture aerial footage of the Notre Dame at Michigan game on Oct. 26.

The Airbnb promotion is in honor of the 150th anniversary of college football.

Apply by Oct. 8: Airbnb offers opportunity for 'sabbatical' to Antarctica to study plastics

Highlights of the two-guest package include:

Hissem will welcome guests to the hangar, which is the size of 2.6 football fields.

A "football lounge," where guests can watch historical college football rivalry games.

A lakefront spot with a grill, fire pit, cornhole and other tailgate essentials

Tickets to the Michigan-Notre Dame game and official gear

Space for up to four friends to join in the fun, though only two guests will be allowed to sleep in the blimp

Airbnb has become known for offering unique, themed bookings, ranging from stays in the Oscar Mayer Wienermobile to Bella Swan's house from "Twilight" to Highclere Castle from "Downton Abbey."
